intro: Tithymalus arvalis, commonly known as the field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in dry meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Tithymalus arvalis is an important nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
